page.title: 03Maryburgh Gala
page.content: The Maryburgh Gala is held annually to raise money so that the Maryburgh Amenities Association can pay their debts.The Gala this year (1985) consisted of a week full of events starting on Friday night with a disco.The next day, Saturday,which was Gala Day.The day started with a pet show,followed by Hockey and Football matches which were played by Maryburgh and Conon Primary Schools.At quarter to two the crowning of the Maryburgh Gala Queen took place.Pupils of Maryburgh School voted for a girl from Primary seven.This year she was Donna MacKinnon and her Two Attendents were Julie Strachan and Gail Williamson.At two o'clock there was a fete ,which had lots of stalls and side shows.The last event of Gala day was the raft race on the Conon river,when home made rafts raced between the two bridges.
